definition: to greet/to go out to meet

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)

sentences.english: Marble statue of Hera greets visitors at the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 一尊大理石赫拉像站立在入口出迎接着参观者。

definition: to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to have an audience (with the emperor)
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
